items.title: Live Cross-Canada Countdown
items.summary_auto: Adrienne Arsenault and Ian Hanomansing host New Year's Eve celebrations live across Canada's six time zones.

items.title: Zelenskyy's year-end message: Ukraine won't sign 'weak' deal that only prolongs war with Russia
items.summary_auto: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, in his New Year address to the nation, said late Wednesday that Kyiv wanted the war to end, but not at any cost, adding he would not sign a "weak" peace agreement that would only prolong the war.

items.title: Trump says he's pausing efforts to send National Guard to Chicago, L.A. and Portland
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump said he's dropping — for now — his push to deploy National Guard troops in Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland, Ore., a move that comes after legal roadblocks hung up the effort.

items.title: Teen sensation Celebrini joins Crosby, McDavid on Canadian men’s Olympic hockey team
Craig's Cookies workers vote to unionize at 5 Toronto stores as franchise expands nationally
items.summary_auto: Nearly 90 employees of Craig’s Cookies have voted to unionize across five shops in Toronto as the Canadian cookie chain expands nationally.

items.title: Teacher wins Guinness World Record for working 61 years at the same school
items.summary_auto: Retired Tennessee teacher Glenda Akin has lived and worked through a whole lot of history. And now she’s made history herself as the Guinness-certified longest serving teacher at the same school .

items.title: Richard Smallwood, gospel singer and musical inspiration, dead at 77
items.summary_auto: Smallwood died Tuesday of complications due to kidney failure, according to his representative. Singer and songwriter Chaka Khan said Smallwood's music "didn't just inspire me, it transformed me."

items.title: Jobs, economy top voters' priorities at the end of a turbulent 2025: Nanos poll
items.summary_auto: A year-end poll from Nanos suggests Canadians will want to see action from the Liberal government on major economic files in the new year.

items.title: Join CBC's live coverage of New Year's Eve celebrations in Canada as the world ushers in 2026
Detroit man crosses border in minivan with 2 front ends — 1 made in Canada, 1 in U.S.
items.summary_auto: Zach Sutton drives the bak2bak, his name for what he created. The front half is an old 1993 Dodge Caravan, the back a 1991 Plymouth Voyager.

items.title: Paris puts graves up for grabs with 'cemetery lottery' to help clean up forgotten tombstones
items.summary_auto: Paris city hall is offering a rare chance to be buried among some of history's most celebrated artists. Dec. 31 was the deadline to register for a draw to purchase a burial spot in Père-Lachaise, one of the city's iconic cemeteries.

items.title: 7 Canadians among dozens injured in Peru train collision: Global Affairs Canada
items.summary_auto: Seven Canadians are among those injured after two trains collided head-on in Peru on Tuesday, Global Affairs Canada confirmed to CBC.

items.title: Stranger Things fans face pricey resale tickets for the show finale’s theatrical release
items.summary_auto: Tickets for the finale — which runs in select theatres on New Year's Eve and New Year's Day — were released early in December and sold out quickly. That’s left fans scouring Facebook Marketplace for resale tickets and disappointed that resale has come to the cinema.

items.title: Increasing AI use in Canadian courtrooms carries risk of errors, penalties: lawyers
items.summary_auto: As AI infiltrates more and more aspects of daily life, it is increasingly making its way into the courts and legal system, lawyers say.

items.title: Here’s what New Year’s celebrations look like as the world rings in 2026
items.summary_auto: Here's a look at how countries around the world are ringing in the new year.

items.title: Isiah Whitlock Jr., known for roles in The Wire and Veep, dead at 71
items.summary_auto: Isiah Whitlock Jr. made frequent TV appearances and worked on numerous films with director Spike Lee. The actor's manager said Whitlock died in New York following a brief illness.

items.title: Turkey detains 125 more ISIS suspects amid countrywide sweep
items.summary_auto: Turkish authorities on Wednesday pressed ahead with countrywide operations against suspected ISIS members, detaining 125 people in simultaneous raids across 25 provinces.

items.title: Governor General praises Canada's 'resounding sense of national pride' in New Year's message
items.summary_auto: Gov. Gen. Mary Simon praised the 'extraordinary solidarity' she saw in Canada in 2025 in her New Year’s address, pointing to the displays of support in communities hit hard by wildfire, the 'unprecedented economic co-operation' and the revitalization of Indigenous cultures and languages.

items.title: Woman dead after being hit by 2 vehicles that left the scene, say Toronto police
items.summary_auto: A woman is dead after being struck by two vehicles in midtown Toronto Wednesday morning.

items.title: Woman dead after being hit by 2 vehicles that left the scene, Toronto police say
items.summary_auto: A woman is dead after being struck by two vehicles in midtown Toronto Wednesday morning.

items.title: Andre De Grasse, Nardwuar among 80 new appointments to the Order of Canada
items.summary_auto: Gov. Gen. Mary Simon has announced 80 appointments to the Order of Canada — a list that includes Olympians, journalists, Indigenous leaders and doctors.

items.title: No timeline for Calgary water main fix, boil-water advisory in place for some areas
8 things to watch for in Alberta politics in 2026
items.summary_auto: Duelling citizen-led petitions related to separation, multiple uses of the notwithstanding clause, a slew of recall petitions, progress on a pipeline deal and municipal elections across the province — 2025 was rife with political news. And already, the year ahead is looking to be just as consequential.

items.title: U.S. lawyers to review millions of pages of Epstein files in January before further release, document shows
items.summary_auto: The U.S. Justice Department revealed it has 5.2 million pages of Epstein files left to review and needs 400 lawyers from four different department offices to help with the process through late January, according to a government document reviewed by Reuters on Tuesday.

items.title: 'My family, they're hurt right now,' says father of man killed in First Nation shooting in Saskatchewan
items.summary_auto: The family of a man killed on Big Island Lake Cree Nation say they're struggling with shock as they try to understand why someone would have shot him.

items.title: 'My family, they're hurt right now,' says father of man killed in shooting on Sask. First Nation
items.summary_auto: The family of a man killed on Big Island Lake Cree Nation say they're struggling with shock as they try to understand why someone would have shot him.

items.title: Transit fares are going up. Why do Canadian cities struggle to keep it affordable?
Death of skier who fell into snow in Banff, Alta., raises a danger of snow sports
items.summary_auto: The death of a skier this past Saturday afternoon  at a Banff ski resort has brought attention to a dangerous side of snow sports. Though her cause of death has not been confirmed, one possibility is that she suffocated.

items.title: 25 years after Ottawa's amalgamation, is there any going back?
items.summary_auto: Former mayors remain split on the 2001 merger that turned a dozen municipalities into one megacity.

items.title: How a good old-fashioned boycott got Canada to trade Kentucky bourbon for Canadian whisky
items.summary_auto: The aromatic, spicy and sometimes smoky flavour of a smooth, Kentucky bourbon has been but a memory for consumers in this country ever since the spirit was caught in the crossfire of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff war and annexation sabre-rattling. As a result, angry Canadians have united behind a "Buy Canadian" movement that experts say is elevating our own whiskies.

items.title: New Ontario fire code rules require carbon monoxide alarms on every floor
items.summary_auto: Changes to the Ontario Fire Code coming in the new year will require carbon monoxide alarms on every level of a home in a bid to better protect people from the deadly, odorless gas.

items.title: Orange-crowned warbler spotted in rare sighting during Christmas bird count in Hamilton, Ont.
items.summary_auto: An orange-crowned warbler was spotted during Hamilton’s annual Christmas bird survey, a “rarity” for birdwatchers, organizers say.

items.title: Landfill search for First Nation woman's remains in Thunder Bay, Ont., comes up empty
items.summary_auto: After a nearly month-long search of the city’s landfill, Deborah Anishinabie’s family is still seeking closure as an investigation into her homicide in Thunder Bay, Ont., continues. Here's what we know about the search for the rest of the 42-year-old's remains, and what First Nation leaders want to see done to address the ongoing crisis of missing and murdered Indigenous women, girls, Two Spirit and gender-diverse people.
